alert.note: Alert for Lexington; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 13 at 6:39AM EDT until March 14 at 1:00PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Columbia affecting Lexington and Richland Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Congaree River At Columbia. * WHEN...From this morning to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Flooding occurs in flood prone areas near and downstream from Columbia. Flooding also occurs on parts of the Cayce and West Columbia river walk. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 9.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 10.7 feet this morning. It will then fall to 8.8 feet and begin rising again this evening. It will rise to 9.5 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall again and remain below advisory stage. - Action stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 645 PM EDT.
